title: VA (John Lee Hooker, Ruth Brown) - Chicago Blues Festival 1990
description:
Various Artists - Chicago Blues Festival June 10, 1990
Chicago Blues Festival
06-10-1990 (June 10) Day 3
Petrillo Music Shell
Grant Park
Chicago, IL

Recorded from the KGNU FM radio broadcast

Unofficial Soundboard Recording - Excellent Sound Quality


Artists List:

Bob Margolin Band with guests:
- Charlie Musselwhite
- Nappy Brown
- Wayne Bennett
- Grady Gaines

Cephas and Wiggins

Ruth Brown & Friends

John Lee Hooker with The Kingsnakes and special guests:
- Willie Dixon
- Buddy Guy
- Wayne Bennett
- Roy Rogers
- Charlie Musselwhite
- Buddy Miles
- Vala Cupp

Notes:

Amazing Blues, R & B and Soul from the 1990's Chicago Blues Festival including outstanding performances by Nappy Brown, Ruth Brown & John Lee Hooker. Especially JLH's show is worth a closer look. He was supported by Chicago Blues band The Kingsnakes (not to confuse with the British King Snakes) and also by some guest musicians - Willy Dixon, Buddy Guy, Wayne Bennet, Roy Rogers, Charlie Musselwhite & Buddy Miles.
Thanks to the original uploader. I only added tags, run audiocheckers and corrected some song titles. Still I'm not sure, if they are all correct. Maybe one of you downloaders can help:
CD3 track4 - JLH's first song  was titled Long Long Baby in the original upload & Have Mercy On Me on guitars101.com. Both is wrong - but what's right?
CD3 track8 - Mabel (?) - it's definetely not JLH's well known Funky Mabel
CD3 track10 was titled Move Baby (?) in the original upload - guitars101.com suggests Doin' the Shout (from Endless Boogie) - guess that's right, but I have to admit, the songs reminds me a lot at James Brown's Shout & Shimmy. - maxblues
